page.title: 07CABBAGE WALKING STICKS
page.content:
{Brassica oleracae longata}is otherwise known as the Giant Jersey Cabbage or Long Jack and has been grown in this area for generations.
The leaves are used as fodder and for human consumption and the stalks as bean-poles, tomato and walking sticks.
Mr Le Gresley, who started L'Etacq Woodcrafts, has been the only person to carry on making walking sticks using the stalks of this vegetable.
Now shoehorns, paperknifes, keyrings and even corkskrews are made.
If you would like to grow your own fifteen foot high giant cabbage then you can even buy some seeds at L'Etacq Woodcrafts' showroom and follow the simple instructions.
